subject: Writing
title: PEN International: Writers Defending Writers
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: PEN International: Writers Defending Writers.

hook.text: Over 900 writers are currently imprisoned worldwide for their words. One organization fights for all of them.

buildup.text: PEN International was founded in 1921 to promote literature and defend freedom of expression globally.

discovery.text: PEN campaigns for imprisoned writers, monitors press freedom, and gives threatened authors safe havens.

twist.text: Its members have included H.G. Wells, Arthur Miller, and Salman Rushdie â€” famous writers protecting unknown ones.

climax.text: PEN's annual reports document censorship worldwide â€” making invisible oppression visible to the global community.

punchline.text: Writers protect writers because they know words are worth dying for.
